prompt:
Patient: I just buy it from the store. It you know, I haven't put that much sought into it since it's only one day.

Nurse: I see, Mr. Valenzuela. It's good that you're keeping it simple. This is indeed a rare time when doctors want their patients to be eating low fiber comfort foods. Now, let's move on to the topic of supplements. You will need to stop any supplements you take like Psyllium husk or any anti-diarrheal medications. Are you currently taking any supplements or anti-diarrheal medications?

Patient: Are you there, Rachel?

Nurse: I'm sorry, Mr. Valenzuela, I didn't quite catch that. Could you please confirm if you're currently taking any supplements or anti-diarrheal medications?

Patient: No. I'm not.

Nurse: Give me a moment to check how I can best support you.

Nurse: Alright, Mr. Valenzuela. If you have any questions later, feel free to ask. Now, I'd like to move onto the instructions for the clear liquid diet and PLENVU laxative solution. This is often the hardest part of the prep. How are you feeling about it?

Patient: Again ready to get this over with.

responses.gpt4: I can appreciate that sentiment. Most people say the procedure itself is no problem at all, but the bowel prep can be a bit tough. We're here to support you every step of the way. Now, about the clear liquid diet. You don't need to start just yet, but 24 hours prior to your procedure, you'll need to start your bowel prep by consuming only clear liquids. This involves no solid foods and drinking either clear or lightly colored beverages without any red or purple dye. Would it be helpful if I provide some examples of clear liquid diet food options?
responses.our_model: I understand, Mr. Valenzuela. It's a common sentiment that the procedure itself is no problem at all, but the bowel prep can be a bit tough. We're here to support you every step of the way. Do you have any questions or concerns about this part of the preparation?
